Configuration values for inialization (programmatically/MIB)
[Initializing / starting / deleting a client]

The following values are used by IPDR_ParametersHandlerFunc and are also in the MIB (see IPDR configuration and monitoring data (MIB), IPDR transmitter (client) MIB overview). Section IPDR reliability mechanism (especially transmitter (client) failure) has more details on values that affect behavior under failure.

Parameter NameOIDDescriptionDefault Value
configuration.exporterAddress 6.1 IP address of the transmitter (client) (as a string). Default interface address

configuration.exporterPort 6.2 transmitter (client) local port number: the collector (server) connects to this port. 15000 (This may change in the future because the port is already assigned by IANA).

configuration.protocolInfoAddr 6.16 IP address used for the UDP-based protocol information which supplies the IPDR version number and data port to the collector (server). configuration. exporterAddress (which defaults to default interface address)

configuration.protocolInfoPort 6.17 UDP port number used for receiving protocol information requests. Value in configuration. exporterPort (which defaults to 15000). If zero, the "protocol version negotiation" port is not opened.

configuration.windowSize 6.7 Obsolete and unused. (Was: Maximum number of outstanding records in the queue. When this value is reached, no more records are sent until at least one acknowledgment is received from the collector (server).) 1000000 (records)

configuration.windowTimeout 6.8 Timeout after which the transmitter (client) makes a transition to an alternate collector (server) when no new data acknowledgments have been received (keep-alives and repeat of the same DSN are ignored in this time-out, which is used only if new data have been sent). 10000 (milliseconds)

configuration.tmplDataTimeout 6.9 Interval between retransmission of TMPL_DATA messages 5000 (milliseconds)

configuration.statisticsInterval 6.10 Interval between statistics reports to the log. If zero, no periodic statistics will be output. 20000 (milliseconds)

configuration.vendorString 6.4 Vendor specific string attached to the exporter. "<code>IPDR Exporter</code>"

configuration.tcpTransport.
flushInterval 		6.12.1.13

Obsolete and unused. (Was: The interval of time after which data is sent. The data is sent if one of the following occurs (as of 2002-03-14, this value is ignored and all data are sent immediately): previously, data was sent if either a "chunk" is full (see queueChunkSize) or this interval has expired.) 500(milliseconds)

configuration.queueChunksize 6.13 Initial memory chunk size for records queue. 16384 (bytes)

configuration.queueInitialNumChunks 6.15 Number of chunks initially allocated for the records queue. If less than 2, it is set to 2. 2

configuration.queueMaxMemory 6.14 Maximum amount of memory allocated for the records queue (0 means unlimited) for each session. See transmitter (client) failure (especially Internal queue sizing) for more information: basically, the value must be maximum-records-per-second � * (average-record-length + 16) �worst-case-failover-time. 0 (bytes) - unlimited

configuration.tcpTransport.
dataRcvChunkSize 		6.12.1.1 Initial chunk size used for received data 16384 (bytes)

configuration.tcpTransport.
dataRcvInitialNumChunks 		6.12.1.3 Number of chunks initially allocated for received data. If less than 2, it is set to 2. 2

configuration.tcpTransport.
dataRcvMaxMemory 		6.12.1.2 Maximum amount of memory allocated for received data (0 means unlimited). Recommended to not set a maximum value - the value will be fairly small and is determined by the number of records in the queue; but if you need a maximum, choose someting like 200000. 0 (bytes) - unlimited

configuration.tcpTransport.
dataSndChunkSize 		6.12.1.7 Initial memory chunk size for sent data. 4096 (bytes)

configuration.tcpTransport.
dataSndInitialNumChunks 		6.12.1.6 Initial number of chunks allocated for sent data (this applies only to control messages). If less than 2, it is set to 2. 2

configuration.tcpTransport.
dataSndMaxMemory 		6.12.1.5 Maximum amount of memory allocated for sent data (0 means unlimited). Recommended to not set a maximum value - the value will be fairly small and is determined by the number of records in the queue; but if you need a maximum, choose someting like 200000. 0 (bytes) - unlimited

configuration.tcpTransport.
sendBuffersChunkSize 		6.12.1.7 Initial memory chunk size for storing references to buffers to be sent. 4096 (bytes)

configuration.tcpTransport.
sendBuffersInitialNumChunks 		6.12.1.9 Initial number of chunks allocated for buffer references. If less than 2, it is set to 2. 2

configuration.tcpTransport.
sendBuffersMaxMemory 		6.12.1.8 Maximum amount of memory allocated for references to buffers to be sent (0 means unlimited). Recommended to not set a maximum value - the value will be fairly small and is determined by the number of records in the queue; but if you need a maximum, choose someting like 200000. 0 (bytes) - unlimited

configuration.console.
consolePort 		6.5.1 Port number of the IPDR transmitter (client) console (0 means disable console) 40000

configuration.console.
consolePassword 		6.5.2 Password used for logging to the IPDR console No password
Not in the MIB: can be set only from parameters
